snippet: The Federal Communications Commission wants to fix E-Rate, a program to give schools telecommunications services, which has been criticized for not keeping up with modern technology.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission votes to overhaul and possibly expand its E-Rate program, $2.3 billion effort to provide schools and libraries with up-to-date telecommunications services and equipment.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission wants to fix E-Rate, a program to give schools telecommunications services, which has been criticized for not keeping up with modern technology.

headline.main: F.C.C. Backs Plan to Update a Fund That Helps Connect Schools to the Internet
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Backs Plan to Update a Fund That Helps Connect Schools to the Internet

keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
keywords.name: organizations
